job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Renton, WA
pros: co-operative staff, peaceful environment, sincere students as majority of them are working adults, flexible hours (only class and office time)
cons: For a quarter or two, instructor has to teach more courses than expected which burdens the instructor.

review_title: Good place to enter higher ed
pros: -Wear many hats, understand library operations -Tenure-track -Work directly with students and faculty -Good benefits
cons: -High turnover at the college -Inconsistent leadership -low morale

review_title: It was a good introduction into an Entry-level IT role
job_title: Assistant Technical Analyst in Renton, WA
pros: I gained experience with hardware deployments, loan processes, device replacements, and basic IT department processes.
cons: The role was only limited to work-study students.

pros: Nice campus good parking spots
cons: Weak management. No follow up or care for employees

review_title: Upper management is out of touch with industry
pros: Nice pay, weekends off, holidays off, great benefits, decent hours, good union.
cons: Too high of workload some times, lack of communication, upper management disconnected and unwilling to listen to industry needs, tries to get employees to do extra work outside of contract for free.

pros: i don’t the culture there
cons: bed place to work in at Renton

pros: 24 vacation and 12 sick days plus one personal day
cons: No growth opportunity within organization

job_title: Facilities Maintenance Technician in Renton, WA
pros: Great place to expand and hone your skills.
cons: As is any other work environment, there are individuals that make it too complicated or almost impossible to complete a task.

review_title: Overall great company to work for
pros: Friendly environment. Very flexible. Room for growth and new learning
cons: Early morning and late nights

pros: Diverse student population, opportunities for continuing education,  professional and curriculum development
cons: Poor hiring and onboarding practices, zero work life balance, divided faculty, lack of on campus resources for handling student issues, weak mid level leadership, hostile work environment, rigged and biased interviews,

pros: Intellectual freedom. Students provide a constant influx of "new" coworkers.  Curriculum development is developed by the instructors so, it is easily adapted and updated.  You can hide and get your work done with little interference.
cons: No raises unless the state government says so.  They are rare.  Management is too hands-off.  Leadership is not very transparent. It is hard to know how and why things are done.  The unions have no teeth and leadership lacks focus.

review_title: A wonderful community to get to be a part of.
pros: Nice benefits and good compensation packages, if you manage to get hired for a FT position.  The people are all wonderful to work with, and the students are great, as well!
cons: There's some slow turn-around in the HR department.  Also, it's really hard to get a FT position here, which means you don't qualify for all the benefits that a Full-Timer gets.

pros:
•	Provide professional customer service
•	Multi-lingual: English, Filipino, Arabic
•	Maintain confidentiality 
•	Ability to communicate with clients and negotiate as required
cons:
•	Provide modernized office support and convert program evaluations into PDF files
•	Keyboarding and 10-key calculator 
•	Knowledge using Word, Power point, Photoshop, Auto Cad(2d), Internet navigation - 5 years in publication, 3d Presentations/Animation.

pros: It is very fulfilling to teach and rewarding.  I worked with professional employees and it was an intellectual growth around such diversity of subjects taught.
cons: The only feedback recieved was from the students, which is only OK if you don't mind working without direct supervision and lead.

review_title: Worked at Renton Technical College in a temporary position
pros: For the most part they have highly dedicated staff and a desire to serve the students who enroll there.
cons: Innovation and funding  limited because of being a part of State governance

pros: Worked with great friendly people
cons: I was overlooked for a position I did 3 months while there was no one to do the job because I was a student who had not yet completed my AAS

pros: Great educational benefits package. Above average medical benefits. Great Vacation accrual if your salary
cons: Lots of interoffice politics, outdated and inefficient helpdesk/IT practices. Seperation of work and home life leaves something to be desired.

pros: Great atmosphere, Management listens to employees and empowers them with resources they need to do well.
cons: If you like being told what to do, this is probably not a good fit.

pros: Managers easy to work with, flexible with time off requests
cons: low pay, few jobs to move into after internship

pros: Professional and respectful employers.  Job was fun and exciting
cons: Lack of communication.  Need to communicate more
